critique: This document is an executive order transferring officers from the Coast and Geodetic Survey to the War Department during a national emergency. It's a temporary measure related to wartime efforts. Ideologically, it doesn't lean strongly in either direction. It expands executive power slightly due to the emergency declaration. It centralizes control under the War Department, indicating a federal primacy approach. National security is prioritized due to the context of a national emergency. There's no direct economic regulation or social inclusion aspect.
